TopicTitle: [1.2.x] [1.4 in Development] Real KSC in KSP Dev Continued

You're awesome dude, I'm downloading right now.

Alright. I've had an...interesting first experience.  

The Imgur album will be below, but I will now explain my humorous tale of woe here.  

Upon loading up a rocket and switching to what I think was LC-16, I look up and there's a field of trees covering the azure sky above me. There was certainly something wrong here. I figure it's just some tress in the sky and I can into space if I just thread the needle.

**<u>I was wrong.</u>**

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/H772j/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Oh man how I was wrong. I started my ascent and prepared for my ultimate demise by an army of plant life ready to stop me. I inch closer and closer to the trees in the sky. The rocket clips through an invisible barrier and explodes into bits shortly after. The trees, in fact, were not in the sky, but I was in the ground. LC-16 was in the ground. Somehow out of all of that the Gryphon I spacecraft still manged to escape without a scratch, just without it's lifter. There's no way we are going to space today, so to everyone's surprise mission control called an abort. The rocket coasts to apogee(about 2,000m above the treepocalypse), then fires it's engines. The Gryphon has no parachutes, because I have no fear. It coasts down nicely to the ground where a launch site almost certainly should have been, but alas, was not. It was a hard landing for the crew, but they kept a good spirit as they waited for the flight director to say "APRIL FOOLS!".  

It was not an April Fools joke. They almost had "death by trees" written upon their gravestone.

Mods being used:  

Scatterer  

MechJeb  

Real KSC + KerbalKonstructs

On KSP 1.1 64bit
